us.pserver.revok.servlet

Class ServletCredentialsSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.pserver.revok.container.ListCredentialsSource
      • us.pserver.revok.servlet.ServletCredentialsSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Credentials>, java.util.Collection<Credentials>, java.util.List<Credentials>, CredentialsSource

    public class ServletCredentialsSource
extends ListCredentialsSource
    Implements a CredentialsSource where the credentials are readed from the web.xml config file as servlet init paramaters. The format of credentials accepted by the ServletCredentialsSource is: <username>:<password>@<name/namespace> (i.e: juno:1234@global). Multiples access can be writed without repeating username and password as follows: juno:1234@global, @io, @calc
    Version:
    1.1 - 201506
    Author:
    Juno Roesler - juno@pserver.com
